April 1997 was the fourth month of that common year. The month, which began on a Tuesday, ended on a Wednesday after 30 days.

Portal:Current events[edit]

Current events of April 1, 1997 (1997-04-01) (Tuesday) edit history watch
  • Comet Hale–Bopp meets or exceeds most predictions when it passes perihelion.
  • The popular television series (based on the video games of the same name), Pokémon premieres on TV Tokyo.
Current events of April 3, 1997 (1997-04-03) (Thursday) edit history watch
  • The Thalit massacre in Algeria: All but one of the 53 inhabitants of Thalit are killed by guerrillas.
Current events of April 11, 1997 (1997-04-11) (Friday) edit history watch
  • Fire damages the Turin Cathedral in Italy.
Current events of April 14, 1997 (1997-04-14) (Monday) edit history watch
  • Fire breaks out in a pilgrim camp on the Plain of Mena, 7 miles (11 km) from Mecca; 343 die.
  • Former S.S. Captain Erich Priebke is retried; on July 22 he is sentenced to 5 years in prison.
Current events of April 16, 1997 (1997-04-16) (Wednesday) edit history watch
  • Houston socialite Doris Angleton is murdered in her River Oaks home. Her brother-in-law, Roger Angleton, later admits to the crime in his suicide note.
Current events of April 18, 1997 (1997-04-18) (Friday) edit history watch
  • The Red River of the North breaks through dikes and floods Grand Forks, North Dakota, and East Grand Forks, Minnesota, causing US$2 billion in damage.
Current events of April 21, 1997 (1997-04-21) (Monday) edit history watch
  • A Pegasus rocket carries the remains of 24 people into earth orbit, in the first space burial.
Current events of April 22, 1997 (1997-04-22) (Tuesday) edit history watch
  • Haouch Khemisti massacre: 93 villagers are killed in Algeria.
  • A 126-day hostage crisis at the residence of the Japanese ambassador in Lima, Peru, ends after government commandos storm and capture the building, rescuing 71 hostages. One hostage dies of a heart attack, 2 soldiers are killed by rebel fire, and all 14 Túpac Amaru rebels are slain.
  • France supports the new transitional government in Zaire, withdrawing its support of Mobutu Sese Seko.
Current events of April 23, 1997 (1997-04-23) (Wednesday) edit history watch
  • 42 villagers are killed in the Omaria massacre in Algeria.
Current events of April 27, 1997 (1997-04-27) (Sunday) edit history watch
  • Andrew Cunanan murders Jeffrey Trail, beginning a murder spree that lasts until July and ends with the murder of fashion designer Gianni Versace.
Current events of April 29, 1997 (1997-04-29) (Tuesday) edit history watch
  • The Organization for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons (OPCW), CWC treaty enters into force.
  • Two trains crash at Hunan, China; 126 are killed.
◀April 1997▶
